ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Bilateral profound sensorineural hearing loss
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Retesting with insert receivers and mastoid bone conduction yielded no responses, confirming that initial responses were vibrotactile artifacts.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Severe mixed hearing loss
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Initial audiogram suggested air-bone gaps, but this was ruled out by normal tympanometry, absent reflexes, and the disappearance of thresholds during retest.

ordered_list.rationale_short: Assessment of speech detection and recognition abilities.
Evaluation of middle ear status to investigate potential conductive component.
Assessment of reflex pathways to cross-check audiometric findings.
Objective measures to confirm cochlear and neural integrity.
Retest with insert receivers and mastoid bone conduction to rule out vibrotactile responses.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Initial testing showed an audiogram resembling severe-to-profound mixed hearing loss with air-bone gaps. However, normal tympanometry and absent acoustic reflexes contradicted a conductive pathology. Objective measures (ABR, OAE) showed no response, supporting severe cochlear damage rather than a mixed loss.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Apparent mixed loss; AC 90-110 dB HL, BC 50-70 dB HL.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: SRT: NR bilaterally; WRS: Could not test.

tests.name: Tympanometry
tests.result_summary: Normal (Type A) bilaterally; static compliance 0.60 cc (Right), 0.57 cc (Left).

tests.name: Acoustic reflexes
tests.result_summary: Absent ipsilateral and contralateral reflexes at 1000 Hz.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Retesting with insert receivers resulted in no responses at audiometer limits, and moving the bone oscillator to the mastoid eliminated BC responses. This confirmed the initial 'hearing' was vibrotactile, establishing a diagnosis of profound sensorineural hearing loss.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: No responses at audiometer limits with insert receivers; BC responses disappeared with mastoid placement.

proposed_items: Inform the physician that the air-bone gap is false, obviating the need for middle-ear surgery
Advise that successful use of hearing aids is unlikely due to lack of residual hearing
Pursue possibility of a cochlear implant
counseling_actions: Explain that previous responses were vibrotactile (felt vibrations) rather than auditory
Discuss the limitations of amplification given the profound loss
Approach changes to communication systems thoughtfully considering the patient's history and manual communication preference

escalation.rationale_short: To communicate the correct diagnosis and prevent the scheduled exploratory middle-ear surgery.

follow_up_plan.objective: Communicate findings to physician to prevent surgery and discuss rehabilitation options (CI, vibrotactile) with family.
